poem:
Title: "Beneath the Scales"

In the cool of evening,
the serpent slithers.
A colored square that blinks
itself awake.

murder unfurled in the tropics,
a poison masked in charm.
On the screen, a tale
of lost years, cruelty stark -

the sudden force of suffering.
Shadows move, sincere,
starlight on a retired badge,
asking, always, who is - The Serpent?
